data.enText: left
left

data.chText: 地方；人
data.enText: place/person

data.chText: 离开（某人或某处）
data.enText: to go away from a person or a place

data.chText: 快点，我们该走了。
data.enText: Come on, it's time we left.

data.chText: 飞机于12:35起飞前往达拉斯。
data.enText: The plane leaves for Dallas at 12.35.

data.chText: 我讨厌离开家。
data.enText: I hate leaving home.

data.chText: 飞机于12:35在希思罗机场起飞。
data.enText: The plane leaves Heathrow at 12.35.

data.chText: 家；工作；学校
data.enText: home/job/school

data.chText: 离开居住地点（或群体、工作单位等）
data.enText: to stop living at a place, belonging to a group, working for an employer, etc.

data.chText: 我的秘书以辞职相要挟。
data.enText: My secretary has threatened to leave.

data.chText: 有些学生16岁就离校了。
data.enText: Some children leave school at 16.

data.chText: 妻子；丈夫
data.enText: wife/husband

data.chText: 遗弃；丢弃
data.enText: to leave your wife, husband or partner permanently

data.chText: 她要抛弃他去跟另一个男人。
data.enText: She's leaving him for another man.

data.chText: 以后要做的事
data.enText: sth to do later

data.chText: 不立刻做；不马上处理
data.enText: to not do sth or deal with sth immediately

data.chText: 盘子先搁着吧，我等会儿再洗。
data.enText: Leave the dishes─I'll do them later.

data.chText: 你怎么什么事都留到最后一刻才处理？
data.enText: Why do you always leave everything until the last moment?

data.chText: 处于某种状态；在某地方
data.enText: sb/sth in condition/place

data.chText: 使保留，让…处于（某种状态、某地等）
data.enText: to make or allow sb/sth to remain in a particular condition, place, etc.

data.chText: 请把门开着吧。
data.enText: Leave the door open, please.

data.chText: 那颗炸弹炸死了25个人。
data.enText: The bomb blast left 25 people dead.

data.chText: 别让她在外边雨里等着。
data.enText: Don't leave her waiting outside in the rain.

data.chText: 把大米煮20分钟。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: Leave the rice to cook for 20 minutes.

data.chText: 使发生；造成，使留下为（某种结果）
data.enText: to make sth happen or remain as a result

data.chText: 红葡萄酒会留下污渍。
data.enText: Red wine leaves a stain.

data.chText: 她给我的印象是她不满意自己的工作。
data.enText: She left me with the impression that she was unhappy with her job.

data.chText: 恐怕你没给我留下选择的余地。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: I'm afraid you leave me no choice.

data.chText: 留下备用（或销售等）
data.enText: to remain to be used, sold, etc.

data.chText: 还有咖啡剩下吗？
data.enText: Is there any coffee left?

data.chText: 剩下的票你还有多少张？
data.enText: How many tickets do you have left?

data.chText: 他们在拼命抢救他们仅余的业务。
data.enText: They are fighting to save what is left of their business.

data.chText: 我可能采取的唯一措施就是通知她的雇主。
data.enText: The only course of action left to me was to notify her employer.

data.chText: 忘了带；丢下
data.enText: to go away from a place without taking sth/sb with you

data.chText: 我把包丢在公共汽车上了。
data.enText: I've left my bag on the bus.

data.chText: 别忘了带上自己的随身物品。
data.enText: Don't leave any of your belongings behind.

data.chText: 他身体不适，因此我们只好把他留下。
data.enText: He wasn't well, so we had to leave him behind.

data.chText: 数学
data.enText: mathematics

data.chText: 剩余；余下
data.enText: to have a particular amount remaining
Seven from ten leaves three.

data.chText: 死后
data.enText: after death

data.chText: 遗下（家人）
data.enText: to have family remaining after your death

data.chText: 他遗下妻子和两个孩子。
data.enText: He leaves a wife and two children.

data.chText: （去世时）遗赠，遗留
data.enText: to give sth to sb when you die

data.chText: 她遗留给女儿100万英镑。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: She left £1 million to her daughter.

data.chText: 她遗留给女儿100万英镑。
data.enText: She left her daughter £1 million.

data.chText: 留给某人的责任
data.enText: responsibility to sb

data.chText: 把…留交；交托；委托
data.enText: to allow sb to take care of sth

data.chText: 你可以把做饭的事交给我。
data.enText: You can leave the cooking to me.

data.chText: 她委托助手来负责。
data.enText: She left her assistant in charge.

data.chText: 把这事留给我吧——我一定会解决的。
data.enText: Leave it with me ─I'm sure I can sort it out.

data.chText: “我们上哪儿吃去？”“我全交给你来决定好了。”
data.enText: ‘Where shall we eat?’ ‘I'll leave it entirely (up) to you (= you can decide) .’

data.chText: 他们把什么都留给我来收拾。
data.enText: They left me with all the clearing up.

data.chText: 就剩下我一个人来单独对付。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: I was left to cope on my own.

data.chText: 递送
data.enText: deliver

data.chText: 递送；递交；投递
data.enText: to deliver sth and then go away

data.chText: 有人给你送来了这张便条。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: Someone left this note for you.

data.chText: 有人给你送来了这张便条。
data.enText: Someone left you this note.

data.chText: 大多数含 leave 的习语，都可在该等习语中的名词及形容词相关词条找到，如 leave sb in the lurch 在词条 lurch 下。
data.enText: Most idioms containing leave are at the entries for the nouns and adjectives in the idioms, for example leave sb in the lurch is at lurch .
leave go (of sth)

data.chText: 松手；撒手；放开
data.enText: to stop holding on to sth

data.chText: 放开我的手臂——你把我弄痛了！
data.enText: Leave go of my arm─you're hurting me!
leave it at that

data.chText: 别再说了；到此为止；就这样算了
data.enText: to say or do nothing more about sth

data.chText: 咱们不可能意见一致，所以这事就这样吧。
data.enText: We'll never agree, so let's just leave it at that.
leave it out

data.chText: （让人停止做某事）行啦，就这样吧
data.enText: used to tell sb to stop doing sth

data.id-g-sent: sb can take it or leave it

data.enText: leave sth↔aside

data.chText: 不予考虑；搁置一边
data.enText: to not consider sth

data.chText: 且不说费用多少，我们真的还需要一辆汽车吗？
data.enText: Leaving the expense aside, do we actually need a second car?
leave sb/sth behind

data.chText: 比…取得好得多的进展；把…抛在后面；超过
data.enText: to make much better progress than sb

data.chText: 英国在开拓新市场方面正被甩在后面。
data.enText: Britain is being left behind in the race for new markets.

data.chText: 永久离开（某人、某地或某国）
data.enText: to leave a person, place or state permanently

data.chText: 她知道童年已一去不复返了。
data.enText: She knew that she had left childhood behind.
leave off

data.chText: 停止（做某事）；中断
data.enText: to stop doing sth

data.chText: 从上次停下来的地方接着读吧。
data.enText: Start reading from where you left off last time.

data.chText: 他停止弹钢琴，应门去了。
data.enText: He left off playing the piano to answer the door.
leave sb/sth↔off (sth)

data.chText: 不把…列入；不包括；不含
data.enText: to not include sb/sth on a list, etc.

data.chText: 你漏掉了一个零。
data.enText: You've left off a zero.

data.chText: 我们未把他列入名单。
data.enText: We left him off the list.
leave sb/sth out (of sth)

data.chText: 不包括；不提及
data.enText: to not include or mention sb/sth in sth

data.chText: 请别把我牵扯进这场争吵。
data.enText: Leave me out of this quarrel, please.

data.chText: 他未被邀请参加聚会，感到颇受冷落。
data.enText: He hadn't been asked to the party and was feeling very left out.

data.chText: 她在accommodation一词中漏掉了一个字母m。
data.enText: She left out an ‘m’ in ‘accommodation’.
be left over (from sth)

data.chText: 剩下；残留
data.enText: to remain when all that is needed has been used

data.chText: 饭菜剩下了不少。
data.enText: There was lots of food left over.

data.chText: 假期；休假
data.enText: a period of time when you are allowed to be away from work for a holiday/vacation or for a special reason

data.chText: 带薪 / 不带薪休假一个月
data.enText: to take a month's paid/unpaid leave

data.chText: 回家休假的士兵
data.enText: soldiers home on leave

data.chText: 休产假；脱产进修
data.enText: to be on maternity/study leave

data.chText: 你们的年假有多长？
data.enText: How much annual leave do you get?

data.chText: 准许；许可
data.enText: official permission to do sth

data.chText: 未经许可擅自缺席
data.enText: to be absent without leave

data.chText: 法庭准许他对判决提出上诉。
data.enText: The court granted him leave to appeal against the sentence.

data.chText: 她请了假去参加葬礼。
data.enText: She asked for leave of absence (= permission to be away from work) to attend a funeral.
by/with your leave

data.chText: 如蒙您允许的话；承蒙俯允
data.enText: with your permission
take leave of your senses

data.chText: 丧失理智；发疯
data.enText: to start behaving as if you are crazy
take (your) leave (of sb)

data.chText: 告辞；辞别
data.enText: to say goodbye

data.chText: 她点头微笑着向朋友告辞。
data.enText: With a nod and a smile, she took leave of her friends.
without a by your leave; without so much as a by your leave

data.chText: 擅自；未经许可；粗鲁地；无礼地
data.enText: without asking permission; rudely
beg leave to do sth

data.chText: 请求准许做某事
data.enText: to ask sb for permission to do sth

ex.chText: 他昨天夜里回来，今天一大早就走了。
ex.enText: He came back last night and went away early this morning.
She went to visit her parents yesterday.

ex.chText: 你的朋友明天什么时候走？
ex.enText: What time is your friend going tomorrow?

synonyms.bx: 最普通用词，指离开目前所在或所住之地。

ex.chText: 她提前下班去接她丈夫。
ex.enText: She left work early to meet her husband.

ex.chText: 我一离开房间宝宝就会哭。
ex.enText: My baby cries when I leave the room.

ex.chText: 电话总是弄得我过不好假日。
ex.enText: Phone calls always spoil my holidays.
The school holiday starts the day after tomorrow.
The manager is away on holiday until July.

synonyms.bx: 通常指不用上班、上学的一段时间，也可指一两天的短假期。

ex.enText: He's asked for a month's leave.

ex.chText: 上校休假时，我指挥这个团。
ex.enText: I'm in command of the regiment while the colonel's on leave.

synonyms.bx: 指得到批准的请假，尤指军人的休假。

ex.enText: What are you going to do for the winter vacation?

ex.chText: 他的新工作有多少天的假期？
ex.enText: How much vacation does he get at his new job?

synonyms.bx: 在英国通常指大学的寒暑假或法庭的休庭期，在美国可指任何假期。

data.chText: 大多数含 leave 的习语，都可在该等习语中的名词及形容词相关词条找到，如 leave sb in the lurch 在词条 lurch 下。
data.enText: Most idioms containing leave are at the entries for the nouns and adjectives in the idioms, for example leave sb in the lurch is at lurch .
leave go (of sth)

data.chText: 松手；撒手；放开
data.enText: to stop holding on to sth

data.chText: 放开我的手臂——你把我弄痛了！
data.enText: Leave go of my arm─you're hurting me!
leave it at that

data.chText: 别再说了；到此为止；就这样算了
data.enText: to say or do nothing more about sth

data.chText: 咱们不可能意见一致，所以这事就这样吧。
data.enText: We'll never agree, so let's just leave it at that.
leave it out

data.chText: （让人停止做某事）行啦，就这样吧
data.enText: used to tell sb to stop doing sth
sb can take it or leave it

data.chText: 要就要，不要就拉倒；取舍请便
data.enText: used to say that you do not care if sb accepts or rejects your offer

data.chText: 可有可无；无所谓；无偏好
data.enText: used to say that sb does not have a strong opinion about sth

data.chText: 跳舞？我跳不跳都行。
data.enText: Dancing? I can take it or leave it.
by/with your leave

data.chText: 如蒙您允许的话；承蒙俯允
data.enText: with your permission
take leave of your senses

data.chText: 丧失理智；发疯
data.enText: to start behaving as if you are crazy
take (your) leave (of sb)

data.chText: 告辞；辞别
data.enText: to say goodbye

data.chText: 她点头微笑着向朋友告辞。
data.enText: With a nod and a smile, she took leave of her friends.
without a by your leave; without so much as a by your leave

data.chText: 擅自；未经许可；粗鲁地；无礼地
data.enText: without asking permission; rudely
beg leave to do sth

data.chText: 请求准许做某事
data.enText: to ask sb for permission to do sth
take French leave

data.chText: 擅离职守
data.enText: to leave work without asking permission first
leave sth↔aside

data.chText: 不予考虑；搁置一边
data.enText: to not consider sth

data.chText: 且不说费用多少，我们真的还需要一辆汽车吗？
data.enText: Leaving the expense aside, do we actually need a second car?
leave sb/sth behind

data.chText: 比…取得好得多的进展；把…抛在后面；超过
data.enText: to make much better progress than sb

data.chText: 英国在开拓新市场方面正被甩在后面。
data.enText: Britain is being left behind in the race for new markets.

data.chText: 永久离开（某人、某地或某国）
data.enText: to leave a person, place or state permanently

data.chText: 她知道童年已一去不复返了。
data.enText: She knew that she had left childhood behind.
leave off

data.chText: 停止（做某事）；中断
data.enText: to stop doing sth

data.chText: 从上次停下来的地方接着读吧。
data.enText: Start reading from where you left off last time.

data.chText: 他停止弹钢琴，应门去了。
data.enText: He left off playing the piano to answer the door.
leave sb/sth↔off (sth)

data.chText: 不把…列入；不包括；不含
data.enText: to not include sb/sth on a list, etc.

data.chText: 你漏掉了一个零。
data.enText: You've left off a zero.

data.chText: 我们未把他列入名单。
data.enText: We left him off the list.
leave sb/sth out (of sth)

data.chText: 不包括；不提及
data.enText: to not include or mention sb/sth in sth

data.chText: 请别把我牵扯进这场争吵。
data.enText: Leave me out of this quarrel, please.

data.chText: 他未被邀请参加聚会，感到颇受冷落。
data.enText: He hadn't been asked to the party and was feeling very left out.

data.chText: 她在accommodation一词中漏掉了一个字母m。
data.enText: She left out an ‘m’ in ‘accommodation’.
be left over (from sth)

data.chText: 剩下；残留
data.enText: to remain when all that is needed has been used

data.chText: 饭菜剩下了不少。
data.enText: There was lots of food left over.

example: he disliked long farewells
he took his leave
parting is such sweet sorrow
she was granted leave to speak

tr: the period of time during which you are absent from work or duty
example: a ten day's leave to visit his mother

tr: leave unchanged or undisturbed or refrain from taking
example: leave it as is
leave the young fawn alone
leave the flowers that you see in the park behind

tr: be survived by after one's death
example: He left six children
At her death, she left behind her husband and 11 cats
I forgot my umbrella in the restaurant
I left my keys inside the car and locked the doors

tr: go and leave behind, either intentionally or by neglect or forgetfulness
example: She left a mess when she moved out
His good luck finally left him
her husband left her after 20 years of marriage
she wept thinking she had been left behind
At what time does your train leave?
She didn't leave until midnight
The ship leaves at midnight

tr: move out of or depart from
example: leave the room
the fugitive has left the country

tr: leave or give by will after one's death
example: My aunt bequeathed me all her jewelry
My grandfather left me his entire estate
give a secret to the Russians
leave your name and address here
impart a new skill to the students

tr: put into the care or protection of someone
example: He left the decision to his deputy
leave your child the nurse's care

tr: remove oneself from an association with or participation in
example: She wants to leave
The teenager left home
She left her position with the Red Cross
He left the Senate after two terms
after 20 years with the same company, she pulled up stakes

tr: have as a result or residue
example: The water left a mark on the silk dress
Her blood left a stain on the napkin

tr: make a possibility or provide opportunity for
permit to be attainable or cause to remain
example: This leaves no room for improvement
The evidence allows only one conclusion
allow for mistakes
leave lots of time for the trip
This procedure provides for lots of leeway

tr: act or be so as to become in a specified state
example: The inflation left them penniless
The president's remarks left us speechless

tr: have left or have as a remainder
example: That left the four of us
19 minus 8 leaves 11

value.def: If you leave a place or person, you go away from that place or person.

example.ex: He would not be allowed to leave the country...
example.tran: 他可能会被禁止离开该国。

example.ex: I simply couldn't bear to leave my little girl...
example.tran: 我就是受不了要离开我的小女儿。

example.ex: My flight leaves in less than an hour...
example.tran: 我乘坐的航班一小时内起飞。

example.ex: The last of the older children had left for school.
example.tran: 年龄较大的几个孩子中，最后一个也已经上学去了。

value.def: If you leave an institution, group, or job, you permanently stop attending that institution, being a member of that group, or doing that job.

example.ex: He left school with no qualifications...
example.tran: 他没有获得任何学历证书便离开了学校。

example.ex: I am leaving to concentrate on writing fiction.
example.tran: 我辞职是为了专心写小说。

example.ex: ...a leaving present.
example.tran: 告别礼物

value.def: If you leave your husband, wife, or some other person with whom you have had a close relationship, you stop living with them or you finish the relationship.

example.ex: He'll never leave you. You need have no worry...
example.tran: 他不会离开你的，你不用担心。

example.ex: I would be insanely jealous if Bill left me for another woman.
example.tran: 要是比尔为了别的女人离开我，我会醋意大发。

value.tran: 抛下，离弃（配偶）；离开（关系亲密的人）

value.def: If you leave something or someone in a particular place, you let them remain there when you go away. If you leave something or someone with a person, you let them remain with that person so they are safe while you are away.

example.ex: I left my bags in the car...
example.tran: 我把包放在车里了。

example.ex: Don't  leave your truck there...
example.tran: 别把货车停在那儿。

example.ex: From the moment that Philippe had left her in the bedroom at the hotel, she had heard nothing of him...
example.tran: 自菲利普把她独自丢在酒店房间后，她就再也没有听到他的消息了。

example.ex: Leave your key with a neighbour in case you lock yourself out one day.
example.tran: 给邻居留把钥匙，以防有朝一日把自己反锁在外面。

value.def: If you leave a message or an answer, you write it, record it, or give it to someone so that it can be found or passed on.

example.ex: You can leave a message on our answering machine...
example.tran: 您可以在我们的答录机上留言。

example.ex: Decide whether the ball is in square A, B, C, or D, then call and leave your answer...
example.tran: 选定球放在A、B、C、D哪个方格，然后打电话来，留下您的答案。

example.ex: I left my phone number with several people.
example.tran: 我把电话号码留给了几个人。

value.def: If you leave someone doing something, they are doing that thing when you go away from them.

example.ex: Salter drove off, leaving Callendar surveying the scene.
example.tran: 索尔特开车走了，剩下卡伦德勘查现场。

value.def: If you leave someone to do something, you go away from them so that they do it on their own. If you leave someone to himself or herself, you go away from them and allow them to be alone.

example.ex: I'd better leave you to get on with it, then...
example.tran: 那我还是让你一个人接着干吧。

example.ex: Diana took the hint and left them to it...
example.tran: 戴安娜会意，任由他们自己去解决。

example.ex: One of the advantages of a department store is that you are left to yourself to try things on...
example.tran: 逛百货公司的其中一个优势是顾客可自行试穿衣服。

example.ex: He quietly slipped away and left me to my tears.
example.tran: 他悄悄溜走了，独剩我一人落泪。

value.tran: 听任（某人做某事）；听（某人）自便

value.def: To leave an amount of something means to keep it available after the rest has been used or taken away.

example.ex: He always left a little food for the next day...
example.tran: 他总是留下一点儿食物第二天吃。

example.ex: Double rooms at any of the following hotels should leave you some change from £150.
example.tran: 以下任何一间酒店的双人房价格都不到150英镑。

value.def: If you take one number away from another, you can say that it leaves the number that remains. For example, five take away two leaves three.
To leave someone with something, especially when that thing is unpleasant or difficult to deal with, means to make them have it or make them responsible for it.

example.ex: ...a crash which left him with a broken collarbone...
example.tran: 造成他锁骨骨折的车祸

example.ex: He left me with a child to support.
example.tran: 他扔下我独自拉扯一个孩子。

value.tran: （尤指把令人不快或困难的事）留给，扔给（某人）

value.def: If an event leaves people or things in a particular state, they are in that state when the event has finished.

example.ex: ...violent disturbances which have left at least ten people dead...
example.tran: 造成至少10人死亡的暴乱

example.ex: The documentary left me in a state of shock...
example.tran: 那部纪录片使我大为震惊。

example.ex: So where does that leave me?
example.tran: 那么我的境况又会如何呢？

value.def: If you leave food or drink, you do not eat or drink it, often because you do not like it.

example.ex: If you don't like the cocktail you ordered, just leave it and try a different one.
example.tran: 你要是不喜欢你要的鸡尾酒，就别喝了，要点别的吧。

value.tran: （常指因不喜欢而）不碰（食物或饮料）

value.def: If something leaves a mark, effect, or sign, it causes that mark, effect, or sign to remain as a result.

example.ex: A muscle tear will leave a scar after healing...
example.tran: 肌肉撕裂复原后会留下疤痕。

example.ex: She left a lasting impression on him.
example.tran: 她给他留下了难以忘怀的印象。

value.def: If you leave something in a particular state, position, or condition, you let it remain in that state, position, or condition.

example.ex: He left the album open on the table...
example.tran: 他把相册摊在桌上没收。

example.ex: I've  left the car lights on...
example.tran: 我没把车灯关掉。

example.ex: I left the engine running.
example.tran: 我动机一直开着。

value.tran: 使处于（某个状态或位置）

value.def: If you leave a space or gap in something, you deliberately make that space or gap.

example.ex: Leave a gap at the top and bottom so air can circulate.
example.tran: 上下各留一个口子通风。

value.def: If you leave a job, decision, or choice to someone, you give them the responsibility for dealing with it or making it.

example.ex: Affix the blue airmail label and leave the rest to us...
example.tran: 贴上蓝色的空邮标签，其余的事情交给我们。

example.ex: The judge should not have left it to the jury to decide...
example.tran: 法官本不该把案子交给陪审团来裁定。

example.ex: For the moment, I leave you to take all decisions.
example.tran: 我把决定权暂时全交给你。

value.tran: 把（工作）交托；把（决定或选择权）留交

value.def: If you say that something such as an arrangement or an agreement leaves a lot to another thing or person, you are critical of it because it is not adequate and its success depends on the other thing or person.

example.ex: The ceasefire leaves a lot to the goodwill of the forces involved...
example.tran: 停火协议的执行很大程度取决于各方武装力量的意愿。

example.ex: It's  a vague formulation that leaves much to the discretion of local authorities.
example.tran: 这只是个模糊的构想，许多方面还要由地方当局来定夺。

value.tran: （安排、协议等很大程度上）视乎，取决于

value.def: To leave someone with a particular course of action or the opportunity to do something means to let it be available to them, while restricting them in other ways.

example.ex: This left me only one possible course of action...
example.tran: 这样我只有一条路可走。

example.ex: He was left with no option but to resign.
example.tran: 他除了辞职外别无选择。

value.tran: 限制（某人于某一行动或机会）

value.def: If you leave something until a particular time, you delay doing it or dealing with it until then.

example.ex: Don't leave it all until the last minute.
example.tran: 不要把什么都拖到最后一分钟。

defx.def: If you leave something too late, you delay doing it so that when you eventually do it, it is useless or ineffective.
defx.tran: 使坐失良机；使为时已晚

example.ex: I hope I haven't left it too late.
example.tran: 但愿我没有错失良机。

value.def: If you leave a particular subject, you stop talking about it and start discussing something else.

example.ex: I think we'd better leave the subject of Nationalism...
example.tran: 我看我们最好还是搁下民族主义这个话题吧。

example.ex: He suggested we get together for a drink sometime. I said I'd like that, and we left it there.
example.tran: 他建议我们找个时间出来喝一杯。我说好，然后我们就换了个话题。

value.def: If you leave property or money to someone, you arrange for it to be given to them after you have died.

example.ex: He died two and a half years later, leaving everything to his wife.
example.tran: 他于两年半后去世，把所有遗产都留给了妻子。

value.def: If you say that someone leaves a wife, husband, or a particular number of children, you mean that the wife, husband, or children remain alive after that person has died.

example.ex: It is for his humanity as much as his music that his numerous friends and pupils will remember him. He leaves a wife, son and daughter.
example.tran: 他的仁爱精神，以及他的音乐，都将长留在无数友人和学生的记忆里。他身后遗下妻子和一对儿女。

value.def: Leave is a period of time when you are not working at your job, because you are on holiday or vacation, or for some other reason. If you are on leave, you are not working at your job.

example.ex: Why don't you take a few days' leave?
example.tran: 你为什么不休几天假？

example.ex: ...maternity leave...
example.tran: 产假

example.ex: He is home on leave from the Navy.
example.tran: 他从海军部队休假回到家里。

value.def: If you ask for leave to do something, you ask for permission to do it.

example.ex: ...an application for leave to appeal against the judge's order.
example.tran: 不服法官指令的上诉申请

value.def: If you leave someone or something alone, or if you leave them be, you do not pay them any attention or bother them.

example.ex: Some people need to confront a traumatic past; others find it better to leave it alone...
example.tran: 有人需要直面过去的创伤，有人则觉得不去想它为妙。

example.ex: Why can't you leave him be?
example.tran: 你就不能不管他？

value.def: You use leaving aside or leaving to one side when mentioning a fact or detail that you want to ignore when making a general statement.

example.ex: Leaving aside the question of privacy, constant surveillance can be remarkably convenient.
example.tran: 如果不去管隐私问题的话，实施不间断监视其实是非常便利的。

value.def: When you take your leave or take leave of someone, you say goodbye and go.

example.ex: He thanked them for the pleasure of their company and took his leave.
example.tran: 他感谢他们的愉快陪伴，然后道别走了。

value.def: If someone tells you to leave well alone, they are telling you not to interfere in something, because it is all right as it is and you might only make it worse.

example.ex: He knew when to leave well alone and when to interfere.
example.tran: 他知道什么时候该适可而止，什么时候该插手干预。

value.tran: 不要弄巧成拙；不要没事找事

value.def: If something continues from where it left off, it starts happening again at the point where it had previously stopped.

example.ex: As soon as the police disappear the violence will take up from where it left off.
example.tran: 警察一走，暴力事件就会死灰复燃。

xrse.def: to leave a lot to be desired
to leave someone to their own devices
to take leave of your senses

trans: 动身去；到…地方去；去某地:
永久离开；抛下；留下；余留；把…抛在后面；超过
休假；请假；度假；正在休假；在休假
剔除，排除（在名单之外）；停止，中断（做某事）
